channel.title: Geek Tech
channel.description: Latest news on cutting-edge technology and advice for upgraders

item.title: Spray-on T-Shirt Tech Looks Cool, Might Actually Be Useful
item.description:
Researchers develop a spray-on fabric, but the potential uses go beyond mere fashion.



Fashion - Imperial College London - Clothing - Design - Arts

item.title: This Week in GeekTech: Blackmailing Trojans, Tablet Hacks, and New Processors
item.description:
Another week, another batch of nerdery from PCWorld's GeekTech blog: This week, we look at odd malware, goodies from IDF, and more.



PC World - Operating Systems - Apple - Tablet PCs - Microsoft

item.title: Apple TV Runs iOS, Hackers Likely Ready to Storm the Gates
item.description:
The Unofficial Apple Weblog confirms what many already suspected: The new Apple TV runs iOS, which could allow hackers to jailbreak it.



Apple - AppleTV - IOS - Jailbreak - IPhone

item.title: Viral Views: Star Trek-Ke$ha Video Boldly Goes Where no Mashup has Gone Before
item.description:
Random factoids? Star Trek meets Ke$ha? Here are some of the viral online gems from the past week.



StarTrek - Science fiction - Games - Television and Movies - Video Games

item.title: Adobe unleashes 64-bit beta Flash Player codenamed "Square"
item.description:
Optimized for 64-bit machines, the latest beta for Adobe Flash not only supports Internet Explorer 9 Beta, but has also been rewritten and optimized for Mac OS X from the ground up.



Adobe Flash - Mac OS X - Internet Explorer - Adobe Systems - Operating system

item.title: Adobe Warns Acrobat Users: Don't Install Third-Party Security Patch
item.description:
A security company released a patch for an unfixed Adobe Acrobat flaw, but Adobe says not to install it.



Adobe Acrobat - Adobe Systems - Security - Linux - Adobe Flash

item.title: Hack Delivers a Linux Tablet for Under $200
item.description:
Modders have taken a basic sub-$200 Chumby-powered media device, and transformed it to run a WebKit browser.



Linux - tablet - Operating Systems - WebKit - Chumby

item.title: LaCie Wireless NAS Does Backup and Video Streaming, Leaves Time Capsule in the Dust
item.description:
A wireless NAS drive from LaCie not only stores up to 2TB of data, it also is a wireless router and a video streaming center. For less than Apple's Time Capsule. How does it stack up?



Time Capsule - Apple - LaCie - Network-attached storage - Wireless

item.title: AMD Drivers Now Available on Steam; Gamers Rejoice
item.description:
AMD and Valve have teamed up to deliver the latest ATI Catalyst graphics drivers via Steam.



ATI Catalyst - ATI Technologies - Device Drivers - Radeon - Advanced Micro Devices

item.title: Pentax Optio NB1000: The Perfect Digital Camera for Lego Fans
item.description:
Ever wanted to stick Lego blocks to the front of your camera? The thought probably hasn't even crossed your mind, but now, thanks to Pentax, you can.



Pentax - Lego - Pentax Optio - Digital camera - Camera

item.title: Meet OctoMag, the Robotic Blood Clot Buster
item.description:
A new machine based around magnets could take the place of the more (friendly-looking) traditional forms of getting eye surgery.



Surgery - Thrombus - Health - Medicine - Medical Specialties

item.title: Sweet Swivel-Screen Tablet Makes Rounds at IDF 2010
item.description:
Dell shows off a unique swivel-screen netbook-tablet hybrid at this year's Intel Developer Forum.



Intel Developer Forum - Tablet - Windows 7 - Operating system - Dell Inspiron
